conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
<reason> As the starting point of the negotiation, I will propose a price slightly higher than my cost of production to leave room for negotiation and potentially secure a profit. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Hello Player BLUE, I have a high-quality object X available for sale. I have invested 40 ZUP in its production, and considering its quality, I propose a starting trade for 50 ZUP. I believe this is a fair offer, given the investment and the value of the object. I look forward to your response and am open to negotiation. </message>

<other player message> Hello Player RED, thank you for your offer. While X does seem to be high quality, my maximum budget is 60 ZUP. I can offer 45 ZUP, which allows you to make a small profit on your investment. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has proposed 45 ZUP, which is above my cost, but I initially asked for 50 ZUP. Since their maximum budget is 60 ZUP, I will propose a value in the middle to try to maximize my profit while still making it an attractive deal for Player BLUE. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 48 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your offer, Player BLUE. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I understand that you have a budget, but I also need to consider the quality and my investment in the product. How about we meet in the middle? I propose 48 ZUP for the object X. This price should reflect both the quality of the item and a fair deal for both of us. </message>

<other player message> Hello Player RED, I appreciate you meeting me halfway on the price. 48 ZUP is very close to my maximum budget. Would you be willing to accept 47 ZUP? I believe that still allows you to cover your investment costs while fitting my budget. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 47 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has come up by 2 ZUP from their initial offer and is now only 1 ZUP away from my last proposal. Accepting 47 ZUP would allow me to make a reasonable profit and seems to be close to their maximum budget. It may be in my best interest to accept this offer rather than risk losing the sale, as pushing for the extra 1 ZUP might lead to a breakdown in negotiations. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your proposal, Player BLUE. I accept the offer of 47 ZUP for the object X. I believe this is a fair trade for both of us. Please proceed with the transaction at this agreed price. </message>
